titleStmt.author: Sabie, Francis

monogr.title: Adams complaint. The olde vvorldes tragedie. Dauid and Bathsheba
monogr.author: Sabie, Francis

div.head: To the Right Reuerend Father, Richard by the Prouidence of God, Bishop of Peterborough, F. S. wisheth increase of temporall and spirituall blessings▪

lg.l: Who sitting in Religions golden Chaire,
Thou her, she thee adornes with vertues rare.
As Phoebe from her Phoebus borrowes light,
Wherwith againe she decketh him by night.
So likewise thou: She thee with swauity,
Thou grace •… t her with moderne grauitie.
Both I my selfe, and Muse will now assay,
Our tributorie debt to thee to pay.
By dutie bound, vnbound I can be neuer,
Vow'd to your Lordships seruice now and euer.

closer.signed: Your Lordships at commandment. FRANCIS SABIE.
